attributes.action: adopt greater consistency, fairness and equity in city - assemblies
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to 'assemble us all together so we resemble an assembly (that was a bit of a tongue twister !).'

Londoners will go to the polls to elect a new mayor and members of the London Assembly on May 1. The petitioner is calling on the P.M. to ensure the British constitution's purpose remains -to provide a parliamentary forum for free discussion, maintaining the equality stated in article 1.

We the undersigned urge the British govt to explain why one city has an assembly and another doesn't - if there are so many different assemblies assembled separately, then govt isn't an assmebly anymore, is it ?! Does devolvement always mean better representation and administration ?

reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
